summary: This document is an email chain from August 16, 2019, regarding a camera system status report at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details the number of operational cameras, outages, and planned technical work, and is forwarded within the US Department of Justice.

persons.name: Jeff
persons.context: Mentioned as a contractor from Signet who will be working on finishing and testing the camera system on generator power at MCC NY.

events.title: MCC NY Camera System Status Report
events.description: A report is generated detailing the status of the camera surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, noting 161 total cameras with 23 outages.

events.title: Camera System Technical Update
events.description: An Electronic Technician provides an update on the MCC NY camera system, stating 161 total cameras, 141-146 currently recording, 15-20 needing work, and 110 correctly labeled. Plans are made for contractor Jeff from Signet to finish work and test the system on generator power.

locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
keyFacts: On August 16, 2019, the camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York had 161 total cameras with 23 outages, representing a 14.3% outage rate.
The day prior, on August 15, 2019, an update indicated only 141-146 cameras were recording, with 15-20 needing work to become operational.
A contractor named Jeff from Signet was scheduled to work on finishing the system and testing it on generator power.
The document establishes a protocol for daily updates on camera outages to be forwarded to the Associate Warden (AW) and Warden on weekdays.
The correspondence is internal to the US Department of Justice regarding the facility's security infrastructure.
